title: Election for Rwandan Presidency
description:
Sourced from predicthq.com - At Stake in this Election: 




The Rwandan Presidency  




Government Structure:  




Chief of State: Paul KAGAME (since 22 April 2000) 






Head of Government: Édouard NGIRENTE (since 30 August 2017) 






Assembly: bicameral Parliament with a 26-seat Senate (Sénat) and an 80-seat Chamber of Deputies (Chambre des Députés) 




Electoral System: 




The President is directly elected by plurality vote and may serve up to two 5-year terms. 






The Prime Minister is appointed by the president. 






In the Senate, 12 members are indirectly elected by local councils, 8 are appointed by the president, 4 are appointed by the Political Organizations Forum, and 2 are selected by institutions of higher learning. All 26 members serve 8-year terms.  






In the Chamber of Deputies, 53 members are directly elected by proportional representation vote, 24 women are selected by special interest groups, and 3 members are selected by youth and disability groups. All 80 members serve 5-year terms. 




Last Election:  


In the 2017 presidential election, Paul Kagame (RPF) won with 98.79% of the vote. Voter turnout was 98%. 


Information for Voters: 


Igikorwa cyo kwiyamamaza: Ibyo wamenya ku mategeko n'amabwiriza abigenga / What you need to know about the rules and regulations (in Kinyarwanda) 




Key Deadlines: 




Candidate filing deadline: May 30th, 2024 






Voter registration deadline: June 13th, 2024 




Main Candidates in this Election:  




Paul KAGAME 






Rwandan Patriotic Front (RPF) 






Frank HABINEZA 






The Democratic Green Party of Rwanda (DGPR / IRDKI) 






Phillipe MPAYIMANA 






Independent 




Population and Registered Voters: 




Population: 13,776,698 (2022 est.) 






Registered Voters: 9,012,789 (2024)  




Gender Data: 




Female Population:  7,035,658 (2022 est.) 






CEDAW Status: Signed 1 May 1980, Ratified 2 March 1981 








Gender Quota:  Yes, at least 30% of members in the House of Deputies must be women and 30% of Senators must also be women.  






Female Candidates in this election: No 






Number of Female Legislators (pre-election): 49 out of 80 (61%) in the House of Deputies and 9 out of 26 (35%) in the Senate  






Human Development Index (HDI) Position: 0.548, Low (2022)  






Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: 19%, High (2023)  




Disability Data: 




CRPD Status: Signed 15 December 2008, Ratified 14 January 2009  






Projected population with a disability: 5% 




IFES Resources: 




Does IFES have a presence in Rwanda: No 






Election Access: Yes
